title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Volume 02
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Now, if ye let me stay quietly here the night wi'the Captain, I'se pay ye double fees for the room; and if ye sayno, ye shall hae the best sark-fu' o' sair banes that ever ye hadin your life the first time ye set a foot by Liddel Moat!'

title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Volume 02
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: An' I forgat to tell ye, there's been anunco inquiry after the auld wife that we saw in Bewcastle; theSheriff's had folk ower the Limestane Edge after her, and down theHermitage and Liddel, and a' gates, and a reward offered for herto appear o' fifty pound sterling, nae less; and Justice Forster,he's had out warrants, as I am tell'd, in Cumberland; and an uncoranging and ripeing they have had a' gates seeking for her; butshe'll no be taen wi' them unless she likes, for a' that.'

title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Volume 02
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: 'Ou, we have nae connexion at a' wi' the Bertrams,' said Dandie;'they were grand folk by the like o' us; but Jean Liltup, that wasauld Singleside's housekeeper, and the mother of these twa youngladies that are gane--the last o' them's dead at a ripe age, Itrow--Jean Liltup came out o' Liddel water, and she was as nearour connexion as second cousin to my mother's half-sister.

title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Volume 02
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: 'We will correct that quality,' answered King Paulus, the first ofthe name; 'we have not forgotten that the moist and humid air ofour valley of Liddel inclines to stronger potations.

title: Guy Mannering; or, The Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Now, if ye let me stay quietly here the night wi' the Captain, I'se payye double fees for the room; and if ye say no, ye shall hae the bestsark-fu' o' sair banes that ever ye had in your life the first time yeset a foot by Liddel Moat!'

title: Guy Mannering; or, The Astrologer - Complete

title: Guy Mannering; or, The Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: 'Ou, we have nae connexion at a' wi' the Bertrams,' said Dandie; 'theywere grand folk by the like o' us; but Jean Liltup, that was auldSingleside's housekeeper, and the mother of these twa young ladies thatare gane--the last o' them's dead at a ripe age, I trow--Jean Liltup cameout o' Liddel water, and she was as near our connexion as second cousinto my mother's half-sister.

title: Guy Mannering; or, The Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: 'We will correct that quality,' answered King Paulus, the first of thename; 'we have not forgotten that the moist and humid air of our valleyof Liddel inclines to stronger potations.

title: Guy Mannering; or, The Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: After a week spent in rural sport, and distinguished by the most frankattentions on the part of his honest landlord, Brown bade adieu to thebanks of the Liddel and the hospitality of Charlie's Hope.

title: Guy Mannering; or, The Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: And now, gudewife, I maun ride, to get to the Liddel or it bedark, for your Waste has but a kittle character, ye ken yoursell.'

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 20
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: Just at the moment when Johnstone's messengerarrived at the manse, then situated high up the hill, upon the brink ofa precipice, the curate was in private converse with a person who wasgiving him the important information, that a conventicle was this veryevening to be held at the Dead-Water--a large mountain-moss, situated onthe Borders, and giving rise to the river Tyne on the one side, and theLiddel on the other.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 20
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: It had rained hard over night, and the Liddel wasrunning dark, smooth, and foam-belled.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 20
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: Yet, peaceful and beautiful as this Scottish Tempe now is, itwas for ages the scene of rapine, blood, and battle--of all those Borderfeuds which, from age to age, concentrated on this point, till thewaters of the Liddel ran red, and its green banks were dyed with theblood of vassal and lord, of Scotchman and Englishman, of Douglas, Hume,Howard, Graham, and Percy.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 20
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: The banks of the Liddel are green, peaceful, and productive.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Amongst his retainers was KinmontWillie, and as Willie rode from the Wardens' meeting, along the banks ofthe Liddel, in company with only three or four men, a body of twohundred English horsemen, commanded by Salkeld, Warden of the EasternMarch, marked him from across the water.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: The snow was still lying in the hollows ofthe Cheviots, the trees were bare, the Liddel and the Esk swollen bythaws and winter rains; but weather was a thing that came but littleinto the reckoning of the men of the Marches unless some foray wasafoot.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Amongst his retainers was KinmontWillie, and as Willie rode from the Wardens' meeting, along the banks ofthe Liddel, in company with only three or four men, a body of twohundred English horsemen, commanded by Salkeld, Warden of the EasternMarch, marked him from across the water.

title: Stories of the Border Marches

author: Scott, Walter
snippet: After a week spent in rural sport, and distinguished by the most frank attentions on the part of hishonest landlord, Brown bade adieu to the banks ofthe Liddel, and the hospitality of Charlies-hope.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The galloway was turned out upon the fell, andwas swear to catch—" Aweel, aweel, there's naehelp for't, but come up the morn at ony rate—Andnow, gudewife, I maun ride, to get to the Liddelor it be dark, for your Waste has but a kittle character, ye ken yoursell."

title: Rambles in Europe ... With historical facts relating to Scotch-American families, gathered in Scotland and the North of Ireland ... Illustrated
author: Morrison, Leonard Allison.
snippet: One mile south of New Castleton are the fourspanning arches of the railroad bridge which crossthe bonnie stream known as the Liddel river.

title: Here and there in the Home Land. England, Scotland and Ireland as seen by a Canadian. ... Profusely illustrated
author: Haight, Canniff.
snippet: By wily turns, by7 desperate bounds,Had baffled Percy's best blood-hounds ;In Eske, or Liddel, fords were noneBut he would ride them one by one ;Alike to him was time or tide,
